results.title: Bail up! The Bushranger on Australia's silent screen (1906-1928)
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This is a selection of fragments and scenes from the only known surviving silent titles of Australias bushranger films which, in the silent years of our cinema, were both prolific and popular. They were a distinctive genre and a significant part of our cultural heritage. But by 1912, censorship bans, provoked by ideas of law and order and morality, effectively robbed Australian moviegoers of a national screen identity. We were then to be culturally colonised by the Hollywood cowboy. This video contains selections from the only known surviving silent narrative titles: Kelly Gang 1906 ; The Story of the Kelly Gang 1906 and 1910 re-release ; Thunderbolt 1910 ; Trooper Campbell 1914 ; The Kelly Gang 1920 ; Robbery under arms 1920 ; When the Kellys were out 1923 ; Trooper OBrien 1928.

results.title: Bahrain: The pearl of the Arabian Gulf
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
Bahrain, an island nation in the Arabian Gulf, was once the capital of the pearl trade and was the site of the first oil discovery in the Gulf States. This includes an interview with the Amir of the State of Bahrain.

results.title: Bagdad Cafe = Out of Rosenheim
results.creator_credit: Percy Adlon, Eleonore Adlon, Hessischer Rundfunk, Bayerischer Rundfunk, Pro-Ject and Pelemele
results.brief_description: Jasmin, a middle aged woman from Bavaria rows with her husband while on holiday in the US. She leaves him and finds herself alone in the desert off route 66, somewhere between Disneyland and Las Vegas. After wandering into a shabby motel complex, “Bagdad Cafe”- a watering hole run by bossy Brenda and frequented by a bizarre collection of individuals- an unlikely friendship develops between the two women. Stars Marianne Sagerbrecht, CCH Pounder and Jack Palance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Percy Adlon, Eleonore Adlon, Hessischer Rundfunk, Bayerischer Rundfunk, Pro-Ject and Pelemele

results.title: Bag of rice = Kiseye berenj
results.creator_credit: Mohammad-Ali Talebi, Mari Iwata, Uta Miyamoto and Digital Media Lab, Inc
results.brief_description: Nobody seems to have time for four year old Jairan. She is from a large Tehranean family, where her parents have to work and her brothers and sisters are all too busy with their homework. One day she manages to convince her neighbour, Mrs Khanoom, to take her on a shopping expedition for a bag of rice. This proves to be demanding feat when, after making their way through the busy streets of Tehran, they find that the shop has already closed.

results.title: Badminton: gripping, footwork, serving
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of correct badminton technique. Shows backhand and forehand grips; placement od feet when serving and playing; and the different types of serves - low short forehand, low short backhand, flick serve and drive serve.

results.title: Badminton fundamentals
results.brief_description: This films intorduces the novuice to the basic rules of the increasingly popular sport of badminton. Illustrates what is needed to play the game, from the court used to the racquets and shuttlecocks and suggested attire (for the 1950s). It also demonstrates the rules of the game, how to play; handgrips, the various strokes and stances and tips for playing better.

results.title: Badminton for Beginners
results.brief_description: A guide to the basic strokes recommended by the Western Australian Badminton Association. This video is designed for both coaches of badminton, and for players new to the game. It clearly demonstrates and explains the fundamentals of stroke production, footwork and court movement.
